primary_trope.name: tier_reveal
primary_trope.hook_text: 328 races. 14 dimensions. Where does Border Wars land?
primary_trope.mechanism: Countdown / ranking — inherent escalation and social comparison.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Border Wars? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Border Wars scored 47 out of 100. Solid tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Border Wars. GA/AL border. 65 mi. GA/AL rolling gravel.
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: The numbers. All fourteen of them. Logistics. 3 out of 5. Competent operation. Shows up on time. Packet pickup at S&S Fire Pits the day before shows local business integration and prevents race morning chaos. Length. 3 out of 5. Proper race distance. Enough to hurt. The 62-mile main option delivers 5000 feet over varied terrain, with Jason Lopez completing it in 5:58 moving time at 245W normalized power. Climate. 3 out of 5. Pack for two seasons. The 2024 race started at 38°F and warmed to 60°F with "20-30 mph gusts with mostly headwind," making the Alabama section particularly challenging. Experience. 3 out of 5. Memorable course. Has character. The GA/AL gravel contrast delivers—Georgia's smooth ridgeline meandering versus Alabama's steep, direct punishment creates a split personality ride. Community. 3 out of 5. Good vibes. Riders actually talk to each other. Donates around $2000 to MTB Atlanta and Heard County Food Pantry, showing local investment. Value. 3 out of 5. Reasonable price for what's offered. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Your road bike might survive. Might. Elevation. 2 out of 5. A few hills. Nothing to lose sleep over. 5000 feet over 62 miles delivers consistent work without massive climbing blocks.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The rest, in rapid succession. Adventure. 2 out of 5. Light adventure. Nothing wild. Prestige. 2 out of 5. Known in certain circles. Niche following. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Basic but functional. Gets the job done. Field Depth. 2 out of 5. Small but scrappy field. Expenses. 2 out of 5. Budget carefully. The extras get you. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Low altitude. Breathe easy.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: GA/AL Border Rolling Gravel. If you're in GA/AL/Southeast and want a local event. yes, it's solid. If you're from out of region. there are better options.
